column5: Well I decided to try my luck out at Hackett lake for my final fishing trip, at least with the outboards.  I trolled and trolled but only came up with two small jacks.  I decided to pull out my 4lb ultra light and fish frozen minnows for pickerel.  I would use a small bait hook with a slit shot and cast and slowly twitch it back along the bottom.  I caught three small jack that thrilled me with their fighting, when I hooked this monster on a minnow barely an inch.     Just to show you this Pike could of ate my reel and rod in one gulp.  Thanks to the Daiwas smooth spool I was confident when it made its huge runs.  When it did surface I could see it was lip hooked and it was not to secure looking.  I had to act fast and gently no horsing this monster    This is definitely my biggest this year and possibly last years although I wish I had a picture to compare.  Incidentally last years big pike was caught on a small jointed Rapala while I was trolling for pickerel.  Only regret is that Hometown Handyman wasn't around for this one.  Sheeeet Happens I guess.  Pike was released for next year.
nice looking pike! Thanks for sharing.
Excellent catch HF!!!  There's a lot to be said for a finesse presentation!  Sometimes the big fish ignore the big baits, only to gobble up a delicious little morsel.
Nice shirt, want me to mail you one? Lol..
That is what I was lookin for.....Maybe next time, or even year...Well done! How many inches was it?
Now that is a decent sized Pike, Big head on it too!
Great report and pics holdfast  Must of give ya a good fight on your ultra light gear....  Good job  Thanks for sharing Leechman
nice way to end the year with a big jackfish!
